dt: {bc}done in a quiet and secretive way to avoid being noticed {bc}{sx|surreptitious||}

pt: {sc}secret{/sc} {sc}covert{/sc} {sc}stealthy{/sc} {sc}furtive{/sc} {sc}clandestine{/sc} {sc}surreptitious{/sc} {sc}underhanded{/sc} mean done without attracting observation. {sc}secret{/sc} implies concealment on any grounds for any motive.
{sc}covert{/sc} stresses the fact of not being open or declared.
{sc}stealthy{/sc} suggests taking pains to avoid being seen or heard especially in some misdoing.
{sc}furtive{/sc} implies a sly or cautious stealthiness.
{sc}clandestine{/sc} implies secrecy usually for an evil, illicit, or unauthorized purpose and often emphasizes the fear of being discovered.
{sc}surreptitious{/sc} applies to action or behavior done secretly often with skillful avoidance of detection and in violation of custom, law, or authority.

quotes.t: This means that they need use only quantum mechanics or only general relativity and can, with a {qword}furtive{/qword} glance, shrug off the barking admonition of the other.
… it made Shepherd look {qword}furtive{/qword}, wary, hunted—as if the photographer had shot him against his will, in the act of slamming the door.
Fall's pleasures were {qword}furtive{/qword}, risky, short-lived-buckeye fights,  … the endless recipes for the apples Mrs. Railsbeck asked him to fetch from the cobwebbed crate in the basement.

shortdef: done in a quiet and secretive way to avoid being noticed : surreptitious
